intro: Erithalis rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf erithalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. The leaves are oval-shaped and have a leathery texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
